rename.to: [DOC-FIX] mlflow ui results with 404  when running the tutorial

body: This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
can someone from mlflow validate this issue?
Thank you for interacting with this issue! Removing the stale label!

Hi @sephib and @asandu1971, I was able to reproduce the issue. The problem happens when you run `mlflow ui` from the root directory of the mlflow repository. If you go into another directory to launch the UI, it should work. For example
```
cd examples
mlflow ui --default-artifact-root ../mlruns --backend-store-uri ../mlruns
```

Thank you Pogil ! With your help I go further  but now I have a little problem with the mlflow serve

When I issued the command 
                 mlflow models serve -m runs:/c94c36bb6c0c48a2a7c895d93ec1866f/model
I get the following
2020/05/06 14:04:33 INFO mlflow.models.cli: Selected backend for flavor 'python_function'
2020/05/06 14:04:35 INFO mlflow.projects: === Creating conda environment mlflow-4133253245e67fa1d3bbd74212a1eb60c04fbc0a ===
Collecting package metadata (repodata.json): done
Solving environment: failed

ResolvePackageNotFound: 
  - scikit-learn=0.22.2.post1

It seems conda cannot find this version of scikit-learn
I have installed https://repo.anaconda.com/archive/Anaconda3-2020.02-Linux-x86_64.sh
Please help me,
Aurel

> 
> 
> Hi @sephib and @asandu1971, I was able to reproduce the issue. The problem happens when you run `mlflow ui` from the root directory of the mlflow repository. If you go into another directory to launch the UI, it should work. For example
> 
> ```
> cd examples
> mlflow ui --default-artifact-root ../mlruns --backend-store-uri ../mlruns
> ```

Thx for the update - currently we are managing to work with mlflow in other project

The general convention is that you launch the `mlflow ui` from the directory where you either ran the example as a MLflow Project `mlflow run . -e <entry_point>` or `cd examples/dir_name; python file_name.py`

Let me know if this is still an issue. We are planning to have more extensive documentation with this `examples` README.md file to clarify and expound how to use these examples
